summary: Henry B. Gonzalez is identified as an authorizing official on several payroll authorization forms for employees of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His signature appears on documents related to staff payroll, indicating his role in approving and overseeing the financial administration of the committee's personnel. The documents span from 1976 to 1978, reflecting Gonzalez's involvement during the active period of the HSCA's investigation. The consistent pattern across the documents is his authorization of payroll actions, suggesting a position of authority within the HSCA's administrative structure.
significance: Henry B. Gonzalez's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his role as an authorizing official within the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the assassination. His authorization of payroll actions indicates his involvement in the administrative functions of the HSCA.
